37.heading: Smith, J. D.
37.title: Changing of the Guard
37.author: Sean McKeever, writer ; Eddy Barrows, et al
37.appears_in: , pencillers ; Ruy José, et al., inkers ; Rod Reis, JD Smith, colorists ; Sal Cipriano, Travis Lanham, Pat Brosseau, letterers.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Teen Titans 62-69."

Summary (from SkyRiver): DC's top teen heroes star in this new collection as they search for fresh candidates to recruit to their crime-fighting cause. But just because they're teens, doesn't mean they don't run into some very mature adventures. This collection reveals the shocking secret of the team's mascot, Wonderdog, and features the final fate of two members. Plus, the Titans face a former teammate gone rogue.

38.heading: Smith, J. D.
38.title: Dominant Species
38.author: story, Chuck Austen ; art, Kia Asamiya ; colors, J
notes: "Originally published in magazine form as Uncanny X-Men #416-420."

Summary (from SkyRiver): As the X-Men adjust to an influx of new students and the recent arrival at the Institute of their former enemy, Juggernaut, a squad of X-Men is called to investigate a murder and, in the process, they uncover a plot to exterminate homo sapiens in favor of mutants.

39.heading: Smith, J. D.
39.title: Hobgoblin
39.author: writer, Brian Michael Bendis ; pencils, Mark Bagley ; inks, Scott Hanna ; colors, J
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate Spider-Man #72-78."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Peter Parker must face off against his best friend when Harry turns himself into the evil Hobgoblin after witnessing the death of his father, the Green Goblin.

40.heading: Smith, J. D.
40.title: Legion of Super-Heroes : Enemy Rising
40.author: Jim Shooter, writer ; Francis Manapul with Aaron Lopresti, Sanford Greene, pencillers ; Livesay with Matt Ryan, Nathan Massengill, inkers ; JD Smith with Nathan Eyring, colorists ; Steve Wands, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Legion of Super-Heroes 37-44."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Lighting Lad discovers that running the greatest team of heroes in existence is hard work and one bad decision could lead to the death of his closest friends.

41.heading: Smith, J. D.
41.title: Lies of our Fathers
41.author: Simon Oliver, writer ; Tony Moore, Mike Hawthorne, John Lucas, pencillers ; Ande Parks, et al
41.appears_in: , inkers ; Brian Buccellato, J.D. Smith, colorists ; Pat Brosseau, letterer ; Philip Bond, Darick Robertson, original series covers ; introduction by Brian Azzarello.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as The Exterminators 11-16."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Henry, Saloth, Nils, and other members of the Bug-Bee-Gone crew have no problem with exploding hamsters, plagues of frogs, and the other creepy crawlies that encounter in the course of a normal workday, but they are nearly undone by troubles that keep resurfacing from their pasts.

42.heading: Smith, J. D.
42.title: Ravager : Fresh Hell
42.author: Sean McKeever, David Hine, writers ; Yildiray Cinar, Georges Jeanty, pencillers ; Julio Ferreira, Mark McKenna, inkers ; JD Smith, Rod Reis, colorists ; Sal Cipriano, Pat Brosseau, letterers.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Faces of Evil: Deathstroke 1, Teen Titans 71-76, 79-82."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Rose Wilson, a.k.a. Ravager, must make the decision to stay with the Teen Titans or seek revenge against her manipulative assassin father, Deathstroke, while a drug that enhances her fighting skills slowly kills her.

43.heading: Smith, J. D.
43.title: Warriors
43.author: writer, Brian Michael Bendis ; pencils, Mark Bagley ; inks, Scott Hanna ; colors, J
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate Spider-Man #79-85."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When Wilson Fisk, the Kingpin of Crime, is forced into hiding, the vacuum left by his absence in the underworld is filled by the dreaded Hammerhead, bringing Peter Parker new troubles.

73.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
73.title: Bone : Rose
73.author: by Jeff Smith ; with illustrations by Charles Vess.
notes: Originally published in the comic book Rose, 2000-2002.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Princess Rose musters up courage to face the dragon that threatens the small towns in the Northern Valley, only to discover the dragon is actually the Lord of the Locusts; and meanwhile, her sister, Princess Briar, embarks on a more sinister quest.

74.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
74.title: Bone Handbook

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A handbook featuring interviews with "Bone" creator Jeff Smith and colorist Steve Hamaker, along with a behind-the-scenes look at how the cover art was colored.

76.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
76.title: The Carl Barks Big Book of Barney Bear
76.author: edited + designed by Craig Yoe ; produced by Clizia Gussoni ; cover + introduction by Jeff Smith ; comics from the collection of Bud Plant.

78.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
78.title: Crown of Horns
78.author: by Jeff Smith ; with color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): It's full-fledged war as Briar, the rat creatures, and the Pawan army storm the city of Atheia. The Bone cousins, Thorn, and Gran'ma Ben are all there to defend the Valley and stop the return of the Lord of the Locusts. When Thorn goes inside a ghost circle, she hears a voice urging her to seek the Crown of Horns. What follows is another dangerous journey for Thorn and loyal Fone Bone as they race to the sacred grounds of the dragons, searching for the one thing that may save them all. This is the breathtaking conclusion to Jeff Smith's nine-book graphic novel series.

88.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
88.title: Lejos de Boneville
88.author: guión y dibujo de Jeff Smith ; color de Steve Hamaker ; traducción Enrique S
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Fone Bone, Phoney Bone, and Smiley Bone are run out of their home, Boneville, and become separated in the wilds, but better fortune begins when the three cousins reunite at a farmstead in a deep forested valley, where Fone meets a young girl named Thorn and her spirited grandmother, Gran'ma Ben. But little do the Bones know, there are dark forces conspiring against them, and their adventures are only just beginning!

91.title: Naked Cartoonists : Drawers Drawing Themselves Without Drawers
91.author: edited by Gary Groth.
notes: Self-portraits by: Scott Adams ; Brent E. Anderson ; Sergio Aragonés ; Robb Armstrong ; Tom Batiuk ; Chip Beck ; Stephen R. 93.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
93.title: Old Man's Cave
93.author: by Jeff Smith with color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: "Originally published in the comic book Bone".

94.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
94.title: Out from Boneville
94.author: by Jeff Smith ; with color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: "The chapters in this book were originally illustrated in the comic book Bone."

Summary (from OCLC): The three Bone cousins, Fone Bone, Phoney Bone, and Smiley Bone, are separated and lost in a vast, uncharted desert. One by one, they find their way into a deep, forested valley filled with wonderful and terrifying creatures. Eventually, the cousins are reunited at a farmstead run by tough Gran'ma Ben and her spirited granddaughter Thorn. But little do the Bones know, there are dark forces conspiring against them, and their adventures are only just beginning!

95.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
95.title: A Parent's Guide to the Best Kids' Comics : Choosing Titles Your Children Will Love
95.author: Scott Robins & Snow Wildsmith ; foreword by Jeff Smith & Vijaya Iyer.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): An introduction to the world of graphic novels for parents. Recommendations lead to the titles sure to capture the imagination and curiosity of your child.

96.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
96.title: Quest for the Spark
96.author: written by Tom Sniegoski ; illustrated by Jeff Smith ; color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): As the evil Nacht spreads his darkness across the valley, Tom and his friends, the Bone family, desperately try to find the Spark that will heal the Dreaming and save the world.

97.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
97.title: Quest for the Spark. book 1
97.author: written by Tom Sniegoski ; illustrated by Jeff Smith ; color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Twelve-year-old Tom Elm, his raccoon friend Roderick, Percival, Abbey, and Barclay Bone, warrior priest Randolf, and forest woman Lorimar join in a quest to find the pieces of the Spark that can save Dreaming, and the Waking World, from a Darkness created by the Nacht.

98.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
98.title: Rasl.
98.author: [No author]
notes: Written and drawn by Jeff Smith.

99.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
99.title: RASL
99.author: by Jeff Smith.

contents.title: Romance at the speed of light
The lost journals of Nikola Tesla.

notes: "Jeff Smith, art direction ; Steve Hamaker, colorist ; Tom Gaadt, additional color & design."
"Parts of this book were originally serialized in the comic book RASL."
Includes bibliographical references (page 3 of unnumbered sequence at end).

Summary (from OCLC): A dimension-jumping art thief races through space and time in search of his next job but becomes distracted by an assassin pursuing him using the same technology he uses to jump across dimensions.

100.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
100.title: Remember Here When You Are There!
100.author: created, written, and illustrated by Larry Marder ; introduction by Jeff Smith.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Collects "Beanworld" comics in which the Pod'l'pool Cuties learn to fly, Beanish writes a love song, and Heyoka and the Big Fish return.

101.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
101.title: Rock Jaw : Master of the Eastern Border
101.author: by Jeff Smith ; with color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: "The chapters in this book were originally published in the comic book Bone."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Fone and Smiley Bone encounter complications in the form of Rock Jaw, an enormous mountain lion, and baby animals orphaned by rat creature attacks as they journey through the wilderness with a lost rat creature cub they are returning to the mountains.

102.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
102.title: Romance at the Speed of Light
102.author: by Jeff Smith.
notes: "From the New York Times best selling author of BONE comes a stark, gritty sci-fi series about a dimension-jumping art thief, a man unplugged from the world racing through space & time searching for his next big score
and trying to escape his past."

103.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
103.title: Rose
103.author: written by Jeff Smith; illustrated by Charles Vess.
notes: Published no. 1 (Nov. 2000) - no. 3 (Feb. 2002), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.

104.heading: Smith, Jeff.
104.title: Rose
104.author: Jeff Smith and Charles Vess ; lettered by Steve Hamaker ; illustration and font design by Charles Vess ; writing and layouts by Jeff Smith.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Princess Rose struggles to defeat the evil Lord of the Locusts who, in the form a dragon, threatens the Northern Valley.

105.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
105.title: Shazam! The Monster Society of Evil
105.author: written & drawn by Jeff Smith ; colored by Steve Hamaker.
notes: Published in 4 nos. from February to June 2007.

106.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
106.title: Shazam! : the Monster Society of Evil
106.author: written and drawn by Jeff Smith ; colored by Steve Hamaker ; introduction by Alex Ross.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as: Shazam! The Monster Society of Evil 1-4."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When a young orphan Billy Batson finds himself transformed into the World's Mightiest Mortal whenever he says the magic word "Shazam!," he must use his extraordinary abilities to face an invasion of alien creatures and stop mad scientist Dr. Sivana and his Monster Society of Evil from taking over the world.

107.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
107.title: Stupid, Stupid Rat Tails
107.author: written by Tom Sniegoski ; drawn by Jeff Smith.

108.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
108.title: Stupid, Stupid Rat-Tails : the Adventures of Big Johnson Bone, Frontier Hero
108.author: written by Tom Sniegoski ; and drawn by Jeff Smith ; Riblet
notes: "The chapters in this book were originally published in the comic book Bone and Stupid, stupid rat-tails."
Summary (from OCLC): The story of Big Johnson Bone, the discoverer of the Rolling Bone River and the founder of Boneville.

109.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
109.title: Tall Tales
109.author: by Jeff Smith with Tom Sniegoski ; color by Steve Hamaker.
notes: Some of the chapters were originally published in the comic book Stupid, Stupid Rat-tails.
Includes a sneak peek at Quest for the Spark Book One a new trilogy written by Tom Sniegoski and illustrated by Jeff Smith.

Summary (from OCLC): Long before the Bone cousins were ever lost in the uncharted forest of the Valley, Big Johnson Bone, the discoverer of the Rolling Bone River, founded Boneville. But little is known of the mighty explorer's adventures before he started his famous trading post. So when Smiley sits down with a group of young scouts to retell the legendary stories of Boneville's origins, what they hear are wild antics complete with Rat Creatures, Dragons, and a snarky little monkey.

110.heading: Smith, Jeff, 1960-
110.title: Treasure Hunters
110.author: Jeff Smith.
notes: "In a strange roof-top kitchen, high above the crowded streets of ancient Atheia, the Bone cousins try to save the city from the clutches of a tyrant. They learn that whoever controls Atheia's fabled treasures will win the loyalty of the soldiers, but time is running out. The Hooded One is drawing near, leading a legion of Rat Creatures bent on the destruction of the city and everyone in it.

157.heading: Smith, Jennifer Margaret.
157.title: Awakening
157.author: Marjorie Liu, writer ; Sana Takeda, artist ; Rus Wooton, lettering & design ; Jennifer M
157.appears_in: Smith, editor ; Ceri Riley, editorial assistant.
notes: "Set in an alternate world of art deco beauty and steampunk horror, Monstress tells the epic story of Maika Halfwolf, a teenage survivor of a cataclysmic war between humans and their hated enemies, the Arcanics. In the face of oppression and terrible danger, Maika is both hunter and hunted, searching for answers about her mysterious past as those who seek to use her remain just one step behind. And all the while, the monster within begins to awaken."

178.heading: Smith, John.
178.title: Jericho. Season 4
178.author: written by Kalinda Vazquez ; story by Dan Shotz, Robert Levine, & Kalinda Vazquez ; art by Andrew Currie, Erfan Fajar, and Claudia Balboni.
notes: "Though Jake Green and Robert Hawkins are happy to be back in Jericho, the challenges they face are daunting. Not only are they fugitives in their own hometown, but they find themselves forced to play host to the newest member of the Jericho community

John Smith... a man who some know as a friend of the resistance, but who Jake and Hawkins know as the man behind the September Attacks. Only they know his secret. And only they can stop him from committing another heinous act."

179.heading: Smith, John.
179.title: "On Their Toes"
179.author: John Smith
179.appears_in: p. 77 in Comic Book Marketplace, v. 2, no. 69 (July 1999).

180.heading: Smith, John.
180.title: Under a Western Sky
180.author: Morris ; translator, Jerome Saincantin.

publication info.place: Originally published as Sous le ciel de l'ouest

notes: Summary (from OCLC): Lucky Luke arrives in Nugget Gulch in the company of another lonesome rider, John 'The Philanthropist' Smith. The town is buzzing with excitement over the coming horse race, and the considerable prize promised to the winner. Financially embarrassed, Luke signs up, counting on his exceptional mount to ensure victory. Unfortunately, Jolly Jumper is stolen just before the race! The lonesome cowboy will have to get by without his old friend this time.

181.heading: Smith, John, 1580-1631.
181.title: "Captain John Smith"

183.heading: Smith, John, 1580-1631.
183.title: Disney's Pocahontas.
183.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): With scenes from the Disney animated film, retells the story of the proud Indian princess who saved the life of John Smith, married an Englishman, and went to England where she met the Queen.

184.heading: Smith, John, 1580-1631.
184.title: Disney's Pocahontas
184.author: adapted by Justine Korman ; illustrated by Don Williams.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): A fictionalized account of the life of Pocahontas who befriended Captain John Smith and the English settlers of Jamestown.

185.heading: Smith, John, 1580-1631.
185.title: Disney's Pocahontas
185.author: adapted from the film by Gina Ingoglia ; illustrated by Franc Mateu.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Even the wild mountain stream must someday join the big river. That's what Pocahontas's father, Chief Powhatan, tells her. He wants her to settle down, marry one of his warriors, and take her proper place in the tribe. But free-spirited Pocahontas has other ideas, especially after she meets the handsome Englishman John Smith. Will her love for this blue-eyed stranger bring her the freedom and true happiness she seeks, or will it bring misfortune and war to the whole tribe?

notes: English, French or Spanish dialogue; closed-captioned.
Originally produced as a motion picture in 1995.
Summary (from OCLC): Legendary tale of Native American Pocahontas and her unlikely romance with British Captain John Smith.

204.heading: Smith, Jonathan D.
204.title: Tomb Raider : Mystic Artifacts
204.author: writer: Dan Jurgens ; penciler: Andy Park ; inker: Jonathan Sibal ; colorists: Jonathan D
204.appears_in: Smith, with John Starr ; letterer: Robin Spehar & Dennis Heisler.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): In this collection, Lara must figure out how to survive against both a Tyrannosaurus Rex as well as the Midnight Squires. This mysterious group is after an artifact in Lara's possession called the Eye of Shaharettin, an orb that allows you to see the future. When the Eye shows Lara what will happen if the Squires gain possession of it, the chase to end all chases begins!
